Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to figure out which cases took longer than usual The event log shows each case with timestamps from start to close So for each case I need to calculate the total time from Receive Ticket to Close Ticket

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the table lets start with Case 101 The first event is 20240301 0800 and the last is 1015 the same day So from 0800 to 1015 is 2 hours and 15 minutes Then Case 102 starts at 0805 and closes on March 2nd at 0915 Thats over a day later so definitely longer Case 103 is from 0810 to 0930 same day about 1 hour 20 minutes Case 104 starts at 0820 and closes next day at 0830 so around 24 hours Case 105 starts at 0825 and closes on March 3rd at 0930 which is two days later

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So the average might be around a few hours but Cases 102 104 and 105 are taking much longer Lets quantify the times Case 101 2h15m Case 102 25h10m from 0805 to next day 0915 Case 103 1h20m Case 104 24h10m Case 105 48h5m

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So 102 104 105 are significantly longer Now looking at their activities

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 102 has an escalation to Level2 The time between Assign to Level1 0900 and Escalate 1130 is 25 hours Then from Escalate to Investigate 1400 same day 25 hours Then Resolve next day at 0900 which is 19 hours later Thats a big wait Maybe the Level2 agent took time to pick it up or investigate

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 104 After Assign to Level1 at 0930 Investigate at 1300 35 hours wait then Resolve next day at 0800 19 hours wait No escalation but long waits before investigate and resolve

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 105 Assigned at 0900 then Investigate at 0910 quick then Escalate at 1000 Then a long wait until March 2nd 1400 to investigate again over 24 hours then Resolve on March 3rd So the escalation led to a very long delay in Level2 investigation

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Potential root causes Escalations cases 102 105 leading to longer processing times possibly because Level2 agents are busy or take longer Also in cases without escalation like 104 there are long waits between steps maybe due to agent availability or workload

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Wait times between activities For example in Case 102 after escalation the investigation happens same day but then resolve is next day In Case 104 after investigation resolve is next day Maybe agents are not working on weekends or evenings Or maybe theres a handoff delay

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Proposals Improve escalation process efficiency ensure Level2 agents have capacity reduce waiting times by better scheduling or prioritization Maybe automate triage to quicker assign complex cases to Level2 sooner Analyze agent workload and add more resources if necessary
